snippet: At one point, $50 billion in federal loan guarantees were meant to cover nuclear projects, but a plant in Georgia may receive the only guarantees made.
abstract: Energy Sec Ernest Moniz is set to announce that he will finish a $6.5 billion loan guarantee and another soon for $1.8 billion to help three Georgia electric companies build first new nuclear reactors in United States in three decades; announcement comes far later than anticipated and may effectively end loan program established in 2005 by Congress, which at one point had promised to support $50 billion in loans for nuclear projects.
lead_paragraph: At one point, $50 billion in federal loan guarantees were meant to cover nuclear projects, but a plant in Georgia may receive the only guarantees made.

headline.main: Loan Program for Reactors Is Fizzling
headline.print_headline: Loan Program for Reactors Is Fizzling
